name: places/ChIJs7Zv8ztZwokRGZLXyBlo7lE
formattedAddress: The Thompson Central Park Hotel, 119 W 56th St, New York, NY 10019, USA
adrFormatAddress: The Thompson Central Park Hotel, 119 W 56th St, New York, NY 10019, USA

originalText.text:
After giving birth to my child, I stayed at Boram Care for a total of eleven days.
When my husband and I arrived at Boram after the delivery, the Boram team welcomed us and made us feel at home.
During my stay, I was able to focus on my physical and mental well-being thanks to the excellent care provided by Boram's staff for both me and my family. This allowed me to develop a stronger bond with my baby and experience the joys of parenthood to the fullest extent from day one.

My sincerest gratitude goes out to the Boram Care team for all the care and training I have received. I strongly recommend this experience, which will make maternity a joy, especially once you return home.

originalText.text: As soon as I heard about Boram Care, I signed up immediately for postnatal care for my second-born for a one week stay. Every mother can benefit from this. The staff was exceptional and so was the food. I loved the classes they held, the 24 hour lounge and was grateful for the round the clock care. Their response time to your requests were also superb.  10/10 rating in terms of having all my postnatal needs met. The stay was a bit pricey as one would expect, but it was worth every penny to me.

text.text: As soon as I heard about Boram Care, I signed up immediately for postnatal care for my second-born for a one week stay. Every mother can benefit from this. The staff was exceptional and so was the food. I loved the classes they held, the 24 hour lounge and was grateful for the round the clock care. Their response time to your requests were also superb.  10/10 rating in terms of having all my postnatal needs met. The stay was a bit pricey as one would expect, but it was worth every penny to me.

originalText.text: I cannot recommend Boram enough!! Boram was instrumental in transitioning my husband and I from the hospital to new parent life. After debating how many nights to stay (3-5), I can safely say 5 nights was absolutely necessary. This allowed us time to physically and mentally transition. The highlight of the experience was the staff! The entire team was incredible. Everyone always had a smile on their face and cared for us like family. They were on call around the clock to help support latch issues, spending hours supporting, teaching and even following up. As first time parents, there was enough to worry about and learn, and the fact Boram provided the personal support along with food,  personal care items, group classes and a space that didn’t leave us thinking about all the “home chores/to do lists” was a game changer. To anyone considering staying, you will not be disappointed. It was easily one of the best decisions we made!

originalText.text:
I had a wonderful pleasure of learning about Boram because a friend recommended Melissa, lactation consultant that really helped in her breastfeeding journey. When I reached out to Melissa, I learned that she transitioned over to Boram and that itself made me think that Boram was worth it. Not only was having a consultant that I trusted worth the money, but the rest of the experience was incredible.

We stayed for 3 nights and the only thing I would change is to stay for 5 or 7 nights. Boram is a great place to transition from the hospital prior to going home. At the hospital, nurses check on your newborn and your vitals and when you get home, no one is checking on your progress. Boram is an incredible interim location where you (the mom) is checked on, fed, and supported on all choices you are making (breastfeeding, lactation support, sleeping, mental health), and you feel secure taking a few hours to sleep during this transition time knowing that your newborn is in good hands with the many skilled care associates around the clock in the nursery.

I had the wonderful pleasure of having many lactation counselors supporting my newborn and I on the breastfeeding journey and had the opportunity between feedings to run out and grab two lovely dinners with my husband (full of excellent sushi in the area).

While Boram is pricey, I absolutely recommend saving Boram to be your push present, it is the best way to learn about taking care of a newborn and taking care of yourself.

P.S. (The Care team is still answering my e-mails and reaching out to see if I need support and this is just incredible!)

originalText.text:
We checked into Boram directly from checking out from the hospital and stayed for 5 nights - I can’t say enough great things about the entire experience. As a first time mom, I really wasn’t sure what to expect but when I came across Boram i figured we would give it a try and my expectations were blown away. It was well worth the price - from the amazing food they give you for breakfast, lunch and dinner to the staff, it’s like the thinking was all taken care of for you so you could focus on healing and learning what to do with your newborn.

Just the fact that i could send a text and someone would appear in my room within minutes to help took so much of the new mom anxiety out of the equation and helped me focus and feel more at ease. Especially when it’s 1am and you can’t figure out why baby isn’t latching. My husband and I have learned so much about breastfeeding, bottle feeding, baby cues and sleep and that alone has made us feel like we’re ready to get home and try this on our own. It has not only given us a chance to rest and recover in this crucial first week but has given us the confidence to know that we can take what we learned here and apply it at home.

I also thought it was SO cool that while hanging out in the mom’s lounge you casually get to meet and chat with the senior level staff members like Boram herself or Sarah the executive director. There is a wealth of knowledge at Boram and they really support moms (and dads!) during this huge milestone.

To the staff at Boram - THANK YOU for all that you do (and did for us!) This was truly a special experience for our little family.
